messages.subject: Re: English Guide to Shinsengumi sites in Kyoto
messages.msgSnippet: ... I love this, and it really is a great guide for anyone that might already know a lot about the Shinsengumi or for those that might not, as well. I am
messages.messageBody:
--- "Trevor" <trevorskingle@...> wrote:
> I've just finished writing the first of three English
> language guides to sites related to the Shinsengumi
> and their activities in Kyoto

I love this, and it really is a great guide for anyone that might already know a lot about the Shinsengumi or for those that might not, as well.

I am really looking forward to seeing the rest of them!! Thank you for doing this and for sharing it with us.

> The third will be a tour guide since the distance between
> the sites in Southern Higashiyama and Fushimi require
> public transport.

Cool!! Can we all go on a Japanese road-trip? If so, I am certainly going on it with you!! (o';'o)

~ Pugsley!! \(^O^)/

messages.subject: English Guide to Shinsengumi sites in Kyoto
messages.msgSnippet: I ve just finished writing the first of three English language guides to sites related to the Shinsengumi and their activities in Kyoto Walk One: The Lair of
messages.messageBody:
I've just finished writing the first of three English language guides to sites related to the Shinsengumi and their activities in Kyoto

Walk One: The Lair of the Mibu Wolves

http://www.scribd.com/doc/16739451/English-Language-Guide-to-the-Shinsengumi-in-Kyoto-Walk-One-Lair-of-the-Mibu-Wolves

Walk Two will be about the sites around Kiyamachi Dori

The third will be a tour guide since the distance between the sites in Southern Higashiyama and Fushimi require public transport
